text: Paolo Taviani (; November 8, 1931 – 29 February 2024) and Vittorio Taviani (; September 20, 1929 – April 15, 2018), both known as the Taviani brothers, were Italian movie directors and screenwriters. They were brothers who always worked together, each directing alternate scenes. They were born in San Miniato, Tuscany, Italy. At the Cannes Film Festival, the Taviani brothers won the Palme d'Or for Padre padrone in 1977 and Grand Prix du Jury for La notte di San Lorenzo (The Night of the Shooting Stars, 1982). In 2012 they reached again the top prize in a major festival, winning the Golden Bear at the Berlin International Film Festival with Caesar Must Die. Vittorio Taviani died on April 15, 2018 in Rome of heart disease at the age of 88. Paolo Taviani died after a short illness in Rome, on 29 February 2024, at the age of 92. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1929 births Category:1931 births Category:2018 deaths Category:2024 deaths Category:Sibling duos Category:Italian movie directors Category:Italian screenwriters Category:Deaths from heart disease Category:People from Tuscany
